title: Calories in Chicken Leg
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken leg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per leg, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Bone-in, skin-on, roasted chicken leg quarter (drumstick + thigh), average size ~133g with edible portion.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, cooking method, brand, and whether skin is included. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: One roasted chicken leg provides ~239 kcal and ~27 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one chicken leg?
faqs.a: About 239 kcal for one roasted, skin-on chicken leg.

faqs.q: Is chicken leg high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~27 g protein per leg, making it a great lean meat option.
Around 159 kcal, as removing skin cuts fat and calories significantly.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in chicken leg?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”roasted is lower; frying adds ~100 kcal from oil absorption.

faqs.q: What about carbs in chicken leg?
faqs.a: Zero carbs naturally; additions like breading or sauce increase them.
